item.title: Anna add a quote by Robert Jordan
item.description: "The Creator made women to please the eye, and to boggle the mind." -- Robert Jordan

item.title: Anna add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Anna add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Logic will get you from A to Z; imagination will get you everywhere." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Anna add a quote by George Washington
item.description: "Labor to keep alive in your breast that little spark of celestial fire called conscience." -- George Washington

item.title: Anna add a quote by Gerald R. Ford
item.description: "A government big enough to give you everything you want is a government big enough to take from you everything you have." -- Gerald R. Ford

item.title: Anna add a quote by George W. Bush
item.description: "One of the great things about books is sometimes there are some fantastic pictures." -- George W. Bush

item.title: Anna add a quote by Ron Paul
item.description: "I'm convinced that you never have to give up liberties to be safe. I think you're less safe when you give up your liberties." -- Ron Paul

item.title: Anna add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Anna add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Anna add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Anna add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Anna add a quote by Sarah Ferguson
item.description:
"Lord, grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change, the courage to change the things I can, and the wisdom to hide the bodies of those people I had to kill because they pissed me off!
" -- Sarah Ferguson

item.title: Anna add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "A wise girl kisses but doesn't love, listens but doesn't believe, and leaves before she is left." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Anna add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Anna add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I refuse to answer that question on the grounds that I don't know the answer" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Anna add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "When his life was ruined, his family killed, his farm destroyed, Job knelt down on the ground and yelled up to the heavens, "Why god? Why me?" and the thundering voice of God answered, There's just something about you that pisses me off." -- Stephen King

item.title: Anna add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The more I know of the world, the more I am convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love. I require so much!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Anna add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Stephenie Meyer: Her vampires are sparkly, which I think we can all agree is wrong." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Anna add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Don't be ridiculous, Charlie, people love the parents who beat their kids in department stores. It's the ones who just let their kids wreak havoc that everybody hates." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Anna add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Shoes off in the whale! And don't try and make a break for the anus." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Anna add a quote by James A. Owen
item.description: "All stories are true. But some of them never happened." -- James A. Owen

item.title: Anna add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Of course it is happening inside your head, Harry, but why on earth should that mean that it is not real?" -- J.K. Rowling
